website_summaries.verdict: Made of cast iron and stainless steel, this is a sturdy, professional grade cutter.
pros: This sturdy gadget cuts all types of potatoes, even sweet potatoes, and other vegetables with little effort
cons: Comes standard with just the 1/2" blade
Other sizes must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: METAL SHAVINGS!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 months now and had been using it 1-2x every week or two to make fries (potato and sweet potato) for my toddler.. However, today when I was cutting the sweet potatos I noticed little silver pieces coming through on the cut pieces and realized pieces of the blades were breaking off onto the fries!! So upset and hoping this hasn't been happening before today.
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: The reason it got a 4 star and not 5 is sweet potatoes MUST be microwaved first or you WILL BEND ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty fry cutter no doubt. I worked in my youth for In-N-Out and cut many thousands of pounds of potatoes and this one is not quite as heavy duty but is more than strong enough for me. The reason it got a 4 star and not 5 is sweet potatoes MUST be microwaved first or you WILL BEND blades.
customer_reviews.author: toddinnv

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is the same brand I purchased 12 years ago that held up beautifully before, this one didn’t last at all. It’s made very low-quality, flimsey & not durable at all & one of the blades bent with normal use beyond repair. So dissappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. Kondratow

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two months....
customer_reviews.text: The last blade I ordered lasted over 6 years. That's with CONTINUOUS cutting each and every day. The company I ordered that from was no longer in business, so I opted to get one of these. Unfortunately, after only 2 months, the blades tore apart from one another (see pics). So much for these blades. Final Verdict: Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: ahoffoss

customer_reviews.title: Useless w/out suction feet!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great--until the suction feet came off--now it is useless! Happened w/in about 3-4 weeks
customer_reviews.author: jay b. itkowitz

customer_reviews.title: Spud nut P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: It's pure junk . Instructions come with it telling you to boil potatoes first . First clue it's a piece of $%^$ . The handle would have to be sic feet long to work , and kid that designed this must of still been in pre school . Terrible design lose all force to cut because of idiotic design only in proper position to cut for a second I'll throw away handle and attach hydraulic cylinder and make an expensive can crushers out of it . I may have to boil the aluminum cans first before I crush them . Absolutely the most disappointing thing I've ever paid good money for .
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: I have only used this three times and pieces of ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this three times and pieces of the blade came off yesterday in the food I was cutting. Luckily I noticed the small metal slivers before serving it to my toddler. Extremely upset considering the harm this could have done to my child.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Holley

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: Once you take it apart to change the blade you can never get it back together. No how to video or customer support. No one to help. All I did was try to change the blade to clean it. The entire thing feel apart. The tray never went back into place, need to get stitches in my hand trying to put it back together. Why did this happen. No help available.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Harkins

customer_reviews.title: Design needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: The first medium sized russet potato going through the cutters bent one of the blades. Not good from the get go! Had to use a lot of force to move the lever. It seems to me that with such a long lever, it would be easy to slice a potato. Not in this case. I think if the blades where absolutely razor sharp, then there wouldn't be such a problem. I returned the item. Not messing with it. I would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Woods

customer_reviews.title: This is a winner!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this New Star Commercial Grade French Fry Cutter for my fiance who is the French Fry King. He loves this French Fry Cutter with all the cutting choices! It cuts each potato with ease and no waste of the potato. For years he cut potatoes into french fries using a big knife and cutting board taking a lot of effort and time (and some cutting accidents too). Wow, what a difference! Less time and effort and safer, making more time to eat and time with the family! Win-win situation!!
customer_reviews.author: ILoveMovies

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great works on sweet potatoes WELL, if you cut them in half first. works on the suction cups on the counter even (really should bolted to the wall, but that would not work in our home kitchen, I have read reviews that talk about if you are going to do sweet potatoes it really needs to be bolted to the wall or counter, worked FINE with just the suction cups. The only negative WHICH I KNOW is that it only cut's one size of fry, but that's the size we like and for such a heavy well made unit I don't consider that a draw back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Marsh

customer_reviews.title: It's big.
customer_reviews.text: I had never used one before and was a little shocked. The first time I tried to use it I put in a whole sweet potato and nothing I did would make it cut that potato into fries. After finally giving up, forcibly removing the sweet potato, and cutting it into smaller pieces I was able to get the job done. I guess it does what it is supposed to do but does have a learning curve to it and isn't easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for potatoes, not so great for sweet potatoes or yams.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I read that it was able to handle sweet potatoes. Unfortunately, it does not work very well with sweet potatoes. I even bought the wedge cutter attachment as I thought that would be easier for sweet potatoes. Neither cutter works very well on them. It is well built but very heavy. If you are looking for an industrial strength cutter just for potatoes, this is it. If you are looking for something for sweet potatoes, best to keep looking, and if you find something, let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Dtouan

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, beefy, with some quirks.
customer_reviews.text: I like the uniformity of the cuts. But after a couple months of use, one of the blades is now curved... I'm pretty sure it's not supposed to be like this. Cleaning is interesting at most; requiring almost complete disassembly.
customer_reviews.author: Frank-Lee

customer_reviews.title: Better than any I've owned prior
customer_reviews.text: We make fries in great quantities several times a year. I have owned, used and broken 4 previous cheaper, smaller, less robust designs from various manufacturers. This unit is exactly what we always needed but were afraid of "investing in". It is large, allowing large potatoes. It is strong, allowing one to muscle it. The suction cups are adequate, even on a butcher block island. I do plan to mount it vertically as suggested in the future to better secure the base for real work, but for now, we have had no problems sticking it to a table for some major potato cutting. If you take pride in your fries, you will be happy with this cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Gutridge

customer_reviews.title: I can use this with my fibromyalgia and cfs love it
customer_reviews.text: This is actually fairly easy to use even with my fibromyalgia and cfs. We had one before this that I could not even get the potatoes started on and I would hang off that thing like a monkey and it would not cut (and I’m not no skinny mini either). This slicer is so easy and smooth cutting just needs a little pressure and you got fries!! Love the different settings, I feel like cleaning is kind of a pain but it’s not horrible. This definitely beats store bought fries any day!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dereksmom

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and a great product
customer_reviews.text: I just had to toss a french fry cutter because the manufacture didn't honor their warranty... in fact that didn't even respond. I received a bad suction cup for this product and within 5 minutes the New Star had responded to my email and started the process to ship me a new foot. Good customer service is hard to find. Besides this thing needing being built like a tank... the company takes pride in what it does!
customer_reviews.author: DerekR

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it. It's heavy duty and doesn't feel like ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. It's heavy duty and doesn't feel like it will break under the pressure of the multitude of potatoes I plan to put through it. It's been used daily since it arrived, and it holds up very well. Cleaning involves removing some screws and using two different brushes (a straw brush and a vegetable cleaner brush) but it's fairly easy for the amount of work it puts out. Would absolutely recommend it, so glad I went with this over the others.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Could not push a small sweet potato through the 1/4" cutting plate
customer_reviews.text: Could not push a small sweet potato through the 1/4" cutting plate. Tried a regular potato and struggled with that as well! I have a cheap fifteen year old cutter I was trying to upgrade that still does a better job! Looks like you could push a boulder through it but looks are definitely deceiving here!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Not that awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Suction cup tore off after one use.... had to get crafty with putting back on. Also very hard to push potato through. Requires a ton of force. Didnt expect that. Also very large. Hard to store in kitchen. Have to dismantle the machine to clean and it is a pain. The concept is good but doesnt work well. Only tried potatoes so far but going to try onion and other veggies. Will see how it goes
customer_reviews.author: Drake Imholte

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good but difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: So for most things this was pretty easy to use. Like other people mentioned, it's pretty difficult to use with sweet potatoes. If I microwaved the sweet potato for a minute or so first it was easier. If you do too long in the microwave though the potato just mushes. My only real complaint is its very difficult to clean. Its quite a lot to unbolt if you are wanting to throughly clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Piece of JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking it seemed like a decent deal. I was WRONG. The suction cups came all bent up, so they don't suck/stick to anything. Then I used it. I cut 4 potatoes and the blade bent. after 4 FREAKING POTATOES. This thing is a heap of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: Buying the 1/4" blade does not include the "pusher"
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Food Star Service french fry cutter that included the 3/8" and 1/2" blades and their respective "pushers" in individual boxes. The 3/8" blade made fries that were too big, so I purchased the 1/4" blade. The pusher was not included! I can't find the 1/4" pusher on Amazon. In my opinion, they should have mde it clear that the pusher was a separate purchase. French fry novices like me need to know that!
customer_reviews.author: Fitmedex

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use, Hard to clean, Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I is ok for small potatoes but a regular idaho potato is not possible-- it requires a lot of force to operate. Also it is hard to get the last potato out of the unit, you have to wrestle the cut fries out of it. It is also bulky and cumbersome, which makes it hard to clean. I gave it 2 stars mainly for the build quality and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Abdelrahman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful French Fry Maker
customer_reviews.text: So it's not that hard to clean, but you do need to take it apart to get it clean. That means three thumbscrews and two Phillip screws. The suction works well but loosens after it sits for a while. It works really well but you do need to cook the sweet potatoes in the microwave for 1.5 minutes for the "red" and 2 min for the white. After that, they cut much easier. Overall I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Scafati

customer_reviews.title: Reassembly requires some care.
customer_reviews.text: This device operates extremely well, however the cutters and pushers cannot be removed without. Loosening the entire assembly so that it becomes extremely difficult to reassemble. Users should note that the chrome plated ‘V’ slide (my words) should always be situated in such way that it does not prevent any screws from seating properly else the device will not come together again.
customer_reviews.author: Ercillor

customer_reviews.title: Great product and stellar customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried because I didn't get a product manual in my box, but the absolutely wonderful person (Angela) at the seller sent me one digitally and walked me through putting it together. I already ran a potato through and it works great. It has suction feet that attached to my table and you just pull the handle up . It's not a lightweight product, so you don't have to worry about it falling apart or breaking.
customer_reviews.author: hack

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece
customer_reviews.text: A heavy duty slicer that does its work fairly well. It need a bit of muscle to slice thru your potatoes. As was indicated by other reviewers, you'll need to take off the blade frame + push pad after each use to clean them (but I don't find that a big problem). Downside: the shipping package could be better. There's no 'user's/ safety instructions manual' included (!?!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product and can cut potatoes with ease. Very sturdy and suction cups work great. Have yet to try cutting other vegetables but purchased the accessory blades and anticipate good results.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisR

customer_reviews.title: Bought this hoping to cut sweet potatos, but thought at the very least it ...
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe that this has more than a 1 star review. Bought this hoping to cut sweet potatos, but thought at the very least it could cut regular potatoes. Couldn’t cut either. Terrible. Have a $19 plastic cutter from target that puts this to shame. I was extremely excited when I got this, because it seems super sturdy. Put it all together, and a butter knife cuts better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. I can go through full size russets ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. I can go through full size russets or Yukom Gold potatoes with ease. I typically cut up to 100 pounds at a time and can do that in under 5 minutes easily. The unit is very heavy and must be dissassembled with tools to properly clean it. I find that mounting it to a plywood base works best.
customer_reviews.author: William McHenry

customer_reviews.title: Metal shards in fries
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointed - we have had so many problems with this. The blade shaves tiny metal pieces into the fries as we cut them, I strongly advice buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: We had a bbq at our church and I chopped over 450 lbs of potatoes for potato salad using the 1/2 inch frinch fry blade. It worked as advertised. Did have to tighten everything up a couple of times. Will be putting thread lock on the frame nuts. Very good quality. Should last a long time. Will be ordering a second one before our next bbq.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loving my new prepping tool!
customer_reviews.text: I received this a day early. I have cut so many fries already! It's so easy to set up. The suction cups are powerful. My son tried to lift it off the sideboard; the sideboard started to come with it! Excited to prep more fries. The one and only complaint (not worth taking a star off), the metal plate that the potato rests on has a small dent from the way it was packaged in the factory. It doesn't change the function.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great Productivity!
customer_reviews.text: This tool has turned my french fry making into a short simple task now! No need to use a knife and definitely don’t have to struggle to press on it with incredible strength like some other cutters I have experienced in the past. I do wish it was a little easier to clean and you did not have to take it apart to clean, because putting the head back on it a little concentration needed.
customer_reviews.author: T. B.

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT DO SWEET POTATOES, Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I read a review that states that it does sweet potatoes. It does not. Ive had friends over to try to operate the leaver. The strength of 1000 men won't make it work. Flimsy construction hidden under the name of Cast Iron. Bit of an adventure to clean, albeit not many components to try. However, works a treat on the potatoes I've tried it on.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas guest

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! This thing is a beast. My only beef is that the suction cups dont work as well as I thought they would so I really dont have a place to store it other than on my breakfast bar. Really wish I could stick it to the side of my fridge or counter. Putting it together the first time was not straight forward either but only took about 10 minutes. Fairly easy to make fries as well as clean. The overall construction is near perfect, minus the 2 rubber gaskets this thing will probably last a few generations!
customer_reviews.author: R.S.

customer_reviews.title: It cannot handle sweet potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: I've read a few reviews saying it can and that is simply not true. I even tried microwaving the sweet potato for a minute or two, but then the ends turn to mush. If you're just looking to make potato fries, this thing is a boss, though. Another issue is that to properly clean it, you have to use a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for making french fries and really is easy to use. Pay attention to the size of the unit, as it is quite large. However, this also helps it to work very well. This is similar to what I have seen mounted to the walls at restaurants such as In N Out Burger. You can make a lot of fries quickly with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get this to replace the cheap potato slicer we had been using. Opened the package and was impressed by the heft of the slicer and figured it would make short work of our potatoes and sweet potatoes. It didn't have any problem with a russet potato, but totally locked up with a sweet potato. Now the slicer is bent and shards of metal are embedded in the potatoes. Do NOT BUY this. I doubt I will be able to get my money back, but will update my review if the company actually stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: HomebrewSoftware

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great, but it's too bulky and tedious to clean
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you own a restaurant or have a big family that eats fries every day. This thing is bulky and the dissasembly process you have to perform in order to clean it is too tedious to make it worth while to use this in the first place. But the good side is that this thing can cut fries like there is no tomorrow. I mean, i could cut a full bag of thin fries in less than a minute. Too bad it will take 10 minutes to clean this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar R. Sosa

customer_reviews.title: very strong fry cutter!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the construction of this item - it's like something you'd find in another time (in terms of durability and quality). Very easy to assemble. I love it and use it. But you'd better have a lot of storage space for it because it takes up about half the top of my dryer. Nice rubber suctioned feet (apparently you could mount this thing to a stud in a wall but I don't know how you'd clean it there). Haven't had it long so I can't really speak to how long the blades will stay sharp. Great heavy-duty product.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Millis Long

customer_reviews.title: For For sweet potatoes cut into pieces that will encounter less than 1/2 the area of the cutter .
customer_reviews.text: Like: Simple construction. Easy to clean. Simple to use. Good value for the price. Dislike: Won't cut sweet potatoes large enough to use the entire area of cutter. Smaller pieces require "bumping" the handle Just trying to push them through is going to wreck something. I bought this to turn 300lbs. of garden sweet potatoes, some of them huge, into fries. This unit will do it but not as easily as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: RK@

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE DRIVE THRU. It’s tine to save and eat healthy.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. No more Mc. Dnd. I make my own. Air fryer and wallah. Look pics. Things needed to put together. Plus you must have some muscles to push on the po-ta-to. It’s a good product. My review is truly honest, if you like it then thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: BOMBAY prince

customer_reviews.title: Strong but hard to clean well
customer_reviews.text: It is a very strong product. Does softer items excellent but stands the test for hard sweet potatoes. Not easy but it will get them. It looks good has great construction. It also holds well to clean counter tops with the suction cups. Worst part: a pain to clean unless you have a Hobart dish washer. It comes apart but is still hard to clean the crevices. Make it worth your while when you use it. Overall I would purchase again but I would also look for comparable products that are easier to clean. This does what we need it to especially to make sweet potato fries!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Yoakley

customer_reviews.title: This Product is Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This product works perfectly. Its very easy to use, has the power to turn potatoes quickly and painlessly into fry cuts. Its very sturdy and well made, suction cups work astonishingly well. Absolutely ZERO wrong with this product. Its a little involved to clean, to really get it clean you do have to take it apart. But I don't find this process too intimidating. Overall, a really great product. I've had several of these in the past made by various manufacturers, but this one is by far the best. Professional, restaurant grade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Used this French fry cutter for the first time today. All I can say is WOW! It is so easy to use I have used other types but nothing as great as this sliced my French fries to perfection pop them in my air fryer and they came out perfect if you are looking for a good cutter this is it
customer_reviews.author: C. Lipinski Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget for fries and other veggies
customer_reviews.text: We love this little critter! I think it looks like a cat. We wanted an easy way to make sweet potato fries to cook in our air fryer. It took a few tries until we got the technique down but worked very well. We use it for other vegetables as well.. A bit more expensive than many, but you certainly get what you pay for. This is a sturdy kitchen tool that is built to last. Eating lots of healthy veggies it helps make food interesting and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Us12345

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely Commercial Grade. Well built, easy to operate. Will last for many years. Would buy again but will probably never need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Sharp blades, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: With KFC no longer offering potato wedges, I thought I'd make my own! This blade attachment really cuts potatoes up very well. Wedges are nice size. I used an air fryer to make the fries. Came out wonderfully. A little pricey, but the material is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G.

customer_reviews.title: Home made fries in a snap
customer_reviews.text: The only caveat with this product is you don't want to use really large potatoes. It works very well with Russet potatoes no longer than about 4.5" Too much girth will also prove to be a slight challenge. Overall it has been an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Luv" It
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but be advised this is just like the one vertically mounted when I made fries for a fast food place 55 years ago. It is a commercial type machine. It takes up room, and is heavy, but does it make perfect fries with little effort. It takes more time to spray it off than to make the actual fries from potatoes. Can't go back to frozen fries anymore. love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jhimi Island

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Take the reviews from people who know what they are doing. Not amateurs or lazy complainers. Great item. Just as item describes. Sweet potatoes are a little tough but if you’ve ever worked with them that’s obvious. However put a little umph into it and this bad boy can do it. Don’t be afraid to put force. This cattail can handle it! Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I can't grill anything without including some cut potatoes on the fire too! This French fry cutter puts all of my other slicers to shame. It's easy to use. Large and small potatoes are a breeze to push through this thing. Takes me literally 1 minute to cut up 5 large potatoes into a plateful of French fries. Quick to clean....just wash off the blade. I probably should've ordered the 1/2" cutter. The 3/8" fries seem to shrivel up fast on the grill.
customer_reviews.author: C. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: MAGNIFICENT
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this wonderful product. It has immense quality, is substantial, works perfectly, is easy to use, and is attractive. Best of all, the price was definitely right. We enjoy the french fries every day. Have never been more impressed with a product from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Cici

customer_reviews.title: It's all metal, it's restaurant quality. It's not for people who hate fries!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly cut fries. OMG. Peel the taters, soak the taters in ice water for an hour or so and dry the taters. Then fry the taters in oil of your choice in 280° oil (the temp will drop but try to keep it around 260°) for 9 minutes. Remove the taters let them cool completely about an hour or more even a day ahead just refrigerate them if it's tomorrow. Then fry them in hot oil 360° for a couple of minutes until they reach the crispyness you want, remove those bad boys sprinkle some salt and eat'em while they're hot!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Even cooking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item to air-fry my french fries. I was using a knife and a cutting board for a while and that was just too time consuming. This thing is easy to use and the fries turn out amazingly well. Great purchase, just wish it was easier to clean. You really need to take the cutting head off to clean it right. It becomes a choir and is awkward to put it back together. I'm going to try cleaning it without taking it apart moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Two

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy it again
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes. The suction is ok. Cleaning the cutting grate is a bit of a pain. I cut sweet potatoes and it takes all of my strength. I wouldn’t buy this again. My wife wants to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Blade hard to replace
customer_reviews.text: It took me approximately 30 minutes to attach the suction feet, and the two places attaching the handle. I then removed the blade to wash the assembly and could not put the blade back on. There are two of us and my husband can really put away the fries, but I did not deem this french fry cutter worth the trouble. The quality appeared excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but tedious to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for us at home due to food allergies. We use on a regular basis, so my only complaint would be that it does clog easily and cleaning can be time consuming. The cutting blade needs to be removed each time, and the rest of the frame becomes a little unstable when it is removed to do so. A few extra nuts on the other side of the cutting blade could have aided in this during the design process. Also, the blades to seem to dull rather quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Fellers

customer_reviews.title: Great for making Mass Quantities
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast compared to the little hand sized fry maker we were using. Cuts through a large potato like butter! This would be perfect for making mass quantities of fries. Beldar would be pleased. It only got tough with sweet potatoes. Then we had to cut the ends off.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Misuraca

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is hard to clean and blades are flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I use this for sweet potato fries. It does a nice job slicing the potatoes. However, it is difficult to clean, and the blades bend very easily. It would be nice if the cutter blades could be rotated so that the blades are used evenly but they are fixed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Hari Nair

customer_reviews.title: Gift and loves it
customer_reviews.text: Understand this is commercial grade so it’s very heavy but also durable. My bachelor son requested it and uses it more than 3 times a week. He is a French fry junkie and is very happy with it. However he says it is a chore to keep it clean and sanitized.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting potatoes and squash. Cuts down on prep time for making fries. Doesn’t require much force when using. Won’t move when using the suction feet. It is rather large and takes up a lot of space. But we love it.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: The Terminator for potatoes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because we tried other cheaper potato cutters here on Amazon, and they all broke like the first time we used them, as the blades would come out and be ruined. Not this one. It's huge and rock solid. You can slam huge potatoes through this and it doesn't flinch. Don't waste your time on cheaper ones; buy this one and be done.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great People and Service  Dull Blade Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered and recieved a New Star 1/4"French Fry Cutter and was very disapointed in it at first. It didn't want to cut the potato. Well, I Talked to the Seller and they were very Courteous and right on top of it. They not only offerd to replace it or give me a return. We settled on a New Blade plus down loading me a Instruction and usage book. I was learning things before it all got off the Press. So it wasn't ALL a dull blade. I will certainly be looking at some of their other products. I'm Sold. Donna Reincke
customer_reviews.author: Donna Reincke

customer_reviews.title: but great kitchen tool for kitchen-gadget lovers
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp as I had thought, but great kitchen tool for kitchen-gadget lovers. Fast and easy way to make great zucchini, carrot, sweet potato, potato, or turnip fries.
customer_reviews.author: Anna J. Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Makes some huge fries.
customer_reviews.text: Makes some huge fries. Actually wish the openings were 1/8” smaller. But it does what it’s supposed to. Not much pressure needed to get potatoes through it. It’s a little hard to clean though.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Dog Lover

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this kitchen tool!!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves french fries but all bagged fries from the stores are either contaminated with gluten or too expensive to buy per bag. This plus a bag of potatoes is all I need to put a dinner time smile on my son's face. Its paid for itself already.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Use for All Stick Veggies
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use. I've used it for potatoes, sweet potatoes, zucchini, egg plant. I then use my air fryer for healthy food! The handle comes off if you want to save space. I use it a lot so it lives in my main cabinet, not in some closet. :) Stop eating processed foods and eat pure food with no chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great kitchen helper
customer_reviews.text: I'm addicted to french fries with potatoes in all kinds and cooking types this one is very sturdy and makes the work so easy and even size so the frying process is good. didn't tried it yet on sweet potatoes think it would be a little dangerous for the blades Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very heavy duty cutter, will slice & dice through any food. Well made, easy to use. I am using it for general household application and it is overkill, but it will get any job done I need.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Great if you like metal shavings in your fries... Very dissatisfied after reading the reviews. I can't imagine this hasn't happened with any of the others.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: cutting mesh isn't all that durable
customer_reviews.text: The base unit is really great. The cutting mesh is a bit on the flimsy side. i use this to cut potatoes into fries and one of the blades bent from what i'd call normal use. Luckily I live near a restaurant supply store so I'll get a higher quality screen there.
customer_reviews.author: A. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t buy. To hard to clean, it’s hard to use unless you got mad muscle...don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Alicky

customer_reviews.title: Prop 65 Contains Lead
customer_reviews.text: The description says this pet is made of aluminum and stainless steal. There is nothing indicating that it contains lead. Thus I was surprised to find a prop 65 Warning on the packaging and that there is lead. Since this item touches food significantly, that seems like a very disingenuous product description.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Homemade healthy fries.
customer_reviews.text: Very solidly built gets the job done fast. We wanted this for homemade healthy fries. We use it to make homemade french fries for the kids and they love it we have the 3/8 inch plate.
customer_reviews.author: Indiana DIY

customer_reviews.title: crappy needs work
customer_reviews.text: overpriced, cutters not sharp requires a lot of pressure to cut just potatoes, Will not cut sweet potatoes/yams. needs to be mounted on a post or beam facing down so will cut most potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Easy & simple making french fries. Cleanup is easy, Well made w No plastic parts to break.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for anyone that is vision impaired as i am having a harder time using knives for slicing. With this, There is no worrying of cutting themselves as I had done before buying this. I wished I had bought this before I cut my finger badly cutting potatoes for dinner using a knife. I'm thinking I'm gonna have it mounted on the wall instead of using it on top of the countertop, It would make it as simple as pulling the handle down and would be up and out of the way when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: M Hecker

customer_reviews.title: bought for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son has been using cheap models to cut his fries and they bend or wont cut til I got this one from Amazon and now I'm the greatest father at 71 in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard England III

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves this thing! I think there will be a potato shortage in this part of the state! It works so well, he doesn't want to stop using it! Well worth the money! The suction cup really hold it in place!! Easy to use,or so I'm told! You won't regret buying this!
customer_reviews.author: peggy criswell

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit causes difficulty taking the blade off to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Operates very well cutting fries. Trouble starts when you unscrew the wing nuts to take the blade off. You have to use a screw driver to “pop” the blade off the machine. I am going to take the blade to a machine shop and see if it is possible to increase the diameter of the holes so it will operate smoothly. Just poor casting of the frame that holds the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Papa

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! Well made and very sturdy. Love the fact that I can mount on the wall. I use it all the time. Very easy to clean and switch out the cutters. I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: rmsteph

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for sweet potatoe fries
customer_reviews.text: This product isn’t quite what I expected. I mainly bought it so I could easily cut sweet potatoe fries, but the blades aren’t sharp enough to do that with ease. It took a lot of pounding to the point the suction cups to hold it to the counter we’re moving. I was hoping for higher quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Don't be cheap, buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, Love it, Love it! We have purchased several cheaper versions of this product over the years and now I'm kicking myself for not just biting the bullet and getting something of this quality sooner. From cutting potatoes for french fries to wedges for roasted potatoes, this thing is great. The suction feet are larger than you would think and they work amazing! Buy this or you'll be sorry if you cheap out and go with the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: p_brick_417

customer_reviews.title: It does the job better than not
customer_reviews.text: I've cut my fair share of potatoes, and have to say that this does a much better job at it than just using a knife or my mandolin slicer with a julienne attachment. I'm giving it four stars because I find that the blades aren't exceptionally sharp to the touch, and subsequently I have to apply a lot of force and rely on the suction cups more than I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Monster cutter. So easy to use. A little hassle to clean. I got this for $12 less cause they said in had minor cosmetic flaws. The unit was in perfect shape. The shipping box had some tears. 😁
customer_reviews.author: chuckypoo

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and sturdy. Its a little tough to make sweet potato ...
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy. Its a little tough to make sweet potato fries with the 3/8 cutter. I can't even imagine trying to make 1/4 sweet potato fries.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: trouble-free & effortless & quality professional/restaurant quality
customer_reviews.text: Professional quality device ; well-built from excellent powder-coated castings & stainless components that will not rust and are easy to clean-up ; the cutter head/plate is easily removed for cleaning and/or change-out to a different size (if you wish another size than the size that comes with the unit, that you can determine in your order selection ; yeah, it makes hella-nice fries ..... the operating handle is long enough to give even the scrawniest "chef" the leverage to make a TON of fries quickly & effortlessly ... AND ... a damned good price for such a professional/restaurant quality appliance
customer_reviews.author: Trinidad de Salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Ease of cleaning
customer_reviews.text: We where looking for something to cut fries. Have tried many versions of cutters, but all failed to meet or needs. This one has been doing the job with ease. Fast cutting, uniform size. Changeable cutter sizes. Easy to clean. Now everybody volunteers to make the fries. Also it's heavy duty. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: tyawn

customer_reviews.title: awsome cutter
customer_reviews.text: Had a small plastic fry maker that was very hard to use. This one makes it easy to go through entire potatoes peeled or not. Have not tried sweet potatoes yet, but will microwave them first to soften. plates change easily but rear requires a Philips screwdriver. this thing is bigger than it looks so you'll need storage space.
customer_reviews.author: dradam

customer_reviews.title: Well
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying this. Though it was a good call, but it was kinda expensive 80$+ being hard to use (need a lot of power) and also the space to keep it, dealing with cleaning it..
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works great easily a commercial quality tool at a consumer price
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty!
customer_reviews.text: They sent me the wrong one the first time and I had to do a return. Have now used this one several times and the family loves it. It cuts right through huge potatoes and is very stable when sitting on the table. I wish I had a bigger kitchen with a good place to mount this thing! Very heavy duty. Seems like something that will last for years, if not decades.
customer_reviews.author: Digital 14

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fry maker, industrial grade, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It's all metal except for the suction cup feet. It can be bolted to the wall too! I'm trying to find out if they have an attachment for cutting and coring apples. That would make this thing absolutely perfect. Definitely industrial grade.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: New Star Commercial Grade Fry Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Wow,,, what a french fry cutter.. Very heavy duty and awesome fry cutter..I don't think it possible to wear this cutter out. Something to pass down to your grand-kids. Has enough throw to cut the biggest potatoes. Works like a charm and easy to break down and clean. I have went through several of the cheap brands over the years. This New Star is the best I have ever used. It is your choice to buy a couple cheap brands or one of these fry cutters for a life-time..Would buy again..Very Satisfied Customer. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out the day it came i, worked great. I grow potatoes at home and they are so much better than the potatoes bought in stores. We like the 3/8" for french fries. On sweet potatoes was a little harder to cut, but it worked, had to use the 1/2". We did cut some with the wedges, they also worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Bigboberta

customer_reviews.title: Another must have in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: My suction this down to a sheet Pan that was slightly larger and in has been holding for 6 months without fail, easy to rinse and clean but you must disassemble and that's the negative part, wish it was a little easier to dissemble
customer_reviews.author: Food Inspector/Nurse John

customer_reviews.title: We didn’t know we needed this!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Ordered the suction feet extra, but ours came with them in the box. It works great. So much easier than doing potatoes by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Irish513

customer_reviews.title: built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tough and heavy built. Great product. It was easy to assemble and hang on the wall. Im pretty sure I could put 100K taders through this thing and it would just keep on trucking. I will never wear this product out.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

product_meta.title: New Star Food Service 42313 Commercial Restaurant French Fry Cutter with Suction Feet, 1/2-Inch
feature_bullets: Heavy-duty cast-iron body with stainless steel components
Suction feet for use on smooth counter tops
Can be permanently mounted on a countertop or wall
Easily cuts potatoes up to 6" long into 1/2" french fries
Makes french fries, sweet potato fries, zucchini sticks and other favorites

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,504 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
